navTitle: Version 1.1.2

---

Released: 25 July 2025

## Highlights

- *New PGD Version Support:* PGD version 5.8 is now supported
- *New PG4K operator Version Support:* PG4K operator v1.26.0 is now supported

## Supported versions

- Kubernetes: 1.33, 1.32, 1.31, and 1.30
- PostgreSQL: 17, 16, 15, 14, and 13

  PostgreSQL 17.5 is the default image
  
  PostgreSQL 13 support ends on November 12, 2025
- PG4K: v1.25.0, v1.25.1, v1.25.2, v1.26.0

## Default images

- PGD: `docker.enterprisedb.com/k8s_enterprise_pgd/postgresql-pgd:17.5-pgd581-ubi9`
- PGD proxy: `docker.enterprisedb.com/k8s_enterprise_pgd/edb-pgd-proxy:5.8.1-ubi9`

This release of EDB Postgres® AI for CloudNativePG™ Global Cluster includes the following:

## Features

<table class="table w-100"><thead><tr><th>Description</th><th width="10%">Addresses</th></tr></thead><tbody>
<tr><td><details><summary>initDB Options for PGDGroup</summary><hr/><p>Supports defining initDB options to pass specific parameters</p>
</details></td><td>#1302</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Major version In-place Upgrade for PGDGroup</summary><hr/><p>Enables cross-branch major version upgrades for PGDGroup.
Major version In-place Upgrade requires operator v1.1.2, working in conjunction with PG4K v1.26.0, PGD v5.8.1,
and above.</p>
</details></td><td></td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>DiscoveryJob Retry Settings</summary><hr/><p>Allows configuration of retry, delay, and timeout parameters for
the discoveryJob.</p>
</details></td><td>#1377</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Reconciliation Loop Control</summary><hr/><p>Adds an annotation to disable reconciliation for PGDGroup, providing more
control over group management.</p>
</details></td><td>#1241</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Physical Join Enhancement</summary><hr/><p>Enables physical joining to nodes with TDE enabled, enhancing security options.</p>
</details></td><td>#1258</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Barman Cloud Plugin Integration</summary><hr/><p>Supports using the barman-cloud plugin for backup, restore, and WAL archiving.
The plugin must be installed in the pg4k operator namespace as a prerequisite.</p>
</details></td><td>#1068</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Flexible PGDGroup Creation</summary><hr/><p>Allows PGDGroup creation with only a single data node.</p></details></td><td>#1200</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Enhanced Operator Image Build</summary><hr/><p>Improves the build process with baking. Now, images are signed with cosign,
and OCI attestations—including the Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) and provenance data—are generated.</p>
</details></td><td>#1115</td></tr>
</tbody></table>


## Bug Fixes

<table class="table w-100"><thead><tr><th>Description</th><th width="10%">Addresses</th></tr></thead><tbody>
<tr><td><details><summary>Inherited Metadata for Scheduled Backups</summary><hr/><p>Ensures that scheduled backups inherit metadata from their
associated PGDGroup.</p>
</details></td><td>#1346</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>LoadBalancer Class Rendering</summary><hr/><p>Correctly renders LoadBalancerClass for LoadBalancer services.</p>
</details></td><td>#1290</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Cleanup of Completed Jobs</summary><hr/><p>Automatically cleans up jobs once the PGDGroup is healthy.</p>
</details></td><td>#1368</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Scheduling Backups Post-Health Check</summary><hr/><p>Delays scheduled backups until the PGDGroup is fully healthy.</p>
</details></td><td>#1276</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Raft Status Check</summary><hr/><p>Checks the global Raft status instead of subgroup-specific status before performing a
physical join.</p>
</details></td><td>#1274</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Backup Node Selection</summary><hr/><p>Filters out replica clusters when assigning backup nodes, avoiding misassignments.</p>
</details></td><td>#1263</td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>First Recoverability Points</summary><hr/><p>Ensures that firstRecoverabilityPoints reflect values from backups taken by any method.</p>
</details></td><td>#1250</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
